commits.subject: feat: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes
commits.body:
Based on Discovery Framework findings, implement "Simplified by Default" approach
for client-facing negotiation sessions.

Input Field Enhancements:
- Add benchmark property for industry standard badges (e.g., "Industry: 5-15%")
- Add essential property to control field grouping
- InputField displays benchmark badges next to labels

Calculator Page Refactor:
- Progressive disclosure: Essential inputs visible, Advanced collapsed
- Sensitivity/Projections moved to collapsible "Advanced Analysis" section
- Transfer Pricing collapsed by default (shows risk badge)
- One-click save with auto-generated names
- Saved options count shown in action bar

This aligns with the 5 design principles from discovery:
1. Client in the room - cleaner, less overwhelming UI
2. Neutral ground first - industry benchmarks prominently displayed
3. Show both sides - Developer/Buyer results always visible
4. Progressive complexity - advanced features tucked away
5. Compare to decide - prominent save, easy comparison flow
commits.title: implement Negotiation Mode UI changes

commits.subject: feat: add incremental processing support for "feed the chicken"
commits.body:
Add manifest-based tracking to enable resumable batch processing:
- scripts/pending.js: Generates pending batches by comparing manifests
  against extracted commits. Supports --rebuild-manifests flag.
- scripts/manifest-update.js: Updates manifest after batch approval
- processed/<repo>/manifest.json: Tracks processed SHAs (source of truth)
- pending/<repo>/batches/: Generated batches of unprocessed commits only

This allows "feed the chicken" to work correctly even after merging
and starting a new session - only truly new/unprocessed commits will
be presented for review.

Updated EXTRACTION_PLAYBOOK.md with new workflow documentation.
commits.title: add incremental processing support for "feed the chicken"

commits.subject: feat: add urgency and impact dimensions to commit analysis schema
commits.body:
Two new dimensions for richer commit insights:

Urgency (1-5): How critical was the change?
- Captures reactive vs planned work patterns
- Helps identify operational health (high urgency = problems)

Impact (internal/user-facing/infrastructure/api): Who is affected?
- Shows where effort goes
- Distinguishes building vs maintaining vs supporting

commits.subject: docs: comprehensive 55+ tag list for commit analysis
commits.body:
Expanded from 11 generic tags to 55+ specific tags across categories:
- User-facing: feature, enhancement, bugfix, hotfix, ui, ux, accessibility, i18n, localization
- Code: refactor, simplify, removal, deprecation, migration, naming, types
- Performance: performance, memory, caching
- Security: security, auth, authorization, vulnerability, sanitization
- Testing: test-unit, test-integration, test-e2e, test-fix, coverage, mocks
- Docs: docs, changelog, comments, api-docs, examples
- Infra: ci, cd, docker, monitoring, hosting
- Build: build, bundler, config, env, lint, formatter
- Deps: dependency-add, dependency-update, dependency-remove, dependency-security
- Database: database, schema, data-migration, seed
- API: api, api-breaking, endpoint
- Git: merge, revert, release, init
- Style: style, imports, whitespace
- Errors: error-handling, logging, validation

AI reads full commit body and assigns ALL applicable tags.

commits.subject: docs: add research items for commit model improvements
commits.body:
New Research/Investigation section in TODO.md:

1. Device/Platform Attribution
   - Split contributions by committer name (mobile vs desktop)
   - Config mapping for name variations with device tags

2. AI-Powered Commit Categorization
   - Claude reads commit messages + diffs to understand intent
   - Auto-tagging beyond conventional commit types
   - Confidence scores and human override

3. Multi-Tag Commit Model
   - One commit can have multiple tags (feat + refactor + docs)
   - Schema change from single type to tags[] with weights
   - Backward compatibility with existing data

4. Tag-Centric Reporting
   - Shift focus from commit counts to accomplishments
   - Effort weighting based on complexity
   - Activity vs output distinction

commits.subject: Add dynamic size constraints for layout sections and cells
commits.body:
- Add MIN_SIZE (10%) and MAX_SIZE (90%) constants
- Dynamic max based on number of items: 100 - (n-1) * 10
  - 2 items: max 90%
  - 3 items: max 80%
  - 4 items: max 70%
- Prevents any section/cell from going below 10%
- Update slider min/max to reflect dynamic constraints

faded icon that clearly shows when cell default is being used.

commits.subject: Make all text inputs multiline for flexibility
Add alignment controls to Text tab
commits.body:
Now users can set horizontal alignment from both:
- Text tab (alongside color, size, style, spacing)
- Layout > Placement tab (with cell context)

Both control the same state property (text[element].textAlign)

commits.subject: Add per-text-element horizontal alignment
commits.body:
Changes alignment from cell-level to text-level for horizontal alignment:
- Each text element (title, tagline, etc.) can now have its own textAlign
- Alignment fallback chain: element → cell → global
- Keeps vertical alignment at cell level (appropriate for layout positioning)

Use case: centered headline with left-aligned body text in same cell

Changes:
- useAdState.js: Add textAlign/textVerticalAlign to each text group
- AdCanvas.jsx: Apply per-element alignment via alignSelf + textAlign
- LayoutSelector.jsx: Add alignment buttons per text element in Placement tab
- CLAUDE.md: Document new alignment architecture

commits.subject: Enable overlay stacking: global + cell overlays layer together
commits.body:

- Cell overlay (Layout > Overlay) stacks on top as additional layer
- Allows combining effects like vignette + gradient for rich visuals
- getCellOverlay no longer falls back to global (handled separately)
- Fixed non-image cell check for enabled: false

commits.subject: Fix per-cell overlay not applying to image cells
commits.body:
The renderImage function was hardcoded to use the global overlay,
ignoring per-cell overlay settings. Now it accepts an overlay config
parameter that respects cell-level overrides for both:
- Multi-cell layouts (rows/columns with image cells)
- Fullbleed layouts (single cell 0)

commits.subject: Revert per-group alignment to cell-level alignment

was rendered in its own absolutely positioned container. This change
reverts to cell-level alignment where all text groups in a cell share
a single alignment container, allowing text to flow naturally.

commits.subject: Merge pull request #19 from illuminAI-select/claude/restore-autoscroll-visualization-24ETg
commits.body: Restore auto-scroll to visualization after fixing freeze issue

commits.subject: Restore auto-scroll to visualization after fixing freeze issue
commits.body:
The page freeze when clicking "Update Visualization" was caused by CSS
transitions on 10,000 squares (fixed in commit cfd34da), not by the
scrollIntoView call that was removed in commit 55a33c8.

Now that the actual performance issue is resolved, we can safely restore
the auto-scroll functionality for better UX. When users click "Update
Visualization" (especially from the sidebar button), the page smoothly
scrolls to show the visualization at the top.

Changes:
- Restore scrollIntoView call in reshuffle() function (app.js:424-428)
- Update claude.md documentation to note auto-scroll feature
- No performance impact since CSS transitions remain removed

commits.subject: Merge pull request #18 from illuminAI-select/claude/fix-visualization-freeze-ZHt5T
commits.body: Fix visualization freeze by removing CSS transition

commits.subject: Fix visualization freeze by removing CSS transition
commits.body:
The page was freezing when clicking "Update Visualization" buttons due to
CSS transitions on 10,000 squares being animated simultaneously. This
overwhelmed the browser's rendering engine.

Changes:
- Remove transition from .square class in styles.css (line 521)
- Update claude.md to document the performance issue
- Remove outdated animation improvement suggestion from docs

The visualization now updates instantly without freezing, providing better
UX as users can see the new distribution immediately rather than waiting
for a 0.4s fade animation.

commits.body: Optimize mobile performance for visibility preset updates

commits.subject: Optimize mobile performance for visibility preset updates
commits.body:
Performance improvements:
- Replace Set-based random selection with efficient Fisher-Yates shuffle
- Add debouncing (300ms) to prevent rapid successive updates
- Batch DOM updates using requestAnimationFrame for smoother rendering
- Only modify squares that need class changes (avoid unnecessary reflows)
- Add loading state to prevent simultaneous update conflicts
- Auto-trigger visualization update after preset selection

These optimizations significantly reduce resource usage on mobile devices
when using quick visibility presets.
